intro: Myrcia heteroclada, commonly known as the pink myrtle, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a pleasant aromatic scent. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
